summary: An FBI Child Sex Tourism Travel Advisory notifying the FBI Legal Attach√© in Paris that convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein is planning to travel to France from September 24 to October 5, 2016. The advisory provides his itinerary, physical description, and passport details, and notes his 2008 conviction.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.role: Convicted Child Sex Offender / Person of Interest

events.title: Epstein's Conviction
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was convicted of procuring a person under the age of 18 for prostitution.

events.title: Planned Departure to France
events.description: Epstein is scheduled to depart from New York, NY, via private aircraft N212JE, arriving at Le Bourget Airport in Paris, France.

events.title: Planned Return from France
events.description: Epstein is scheduled to return from France to the United States.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted on June 30, 2008, of procuring a person under 18 for prostitution.
In September 2016, the FBI issued a travel advisory notifying French authorities of Epstein's planned trip to France from September 24 to October 5, 2016.
Epstein planned to travel via a private aircraft with U.S. registration number N212JE.
The advisory provided Epstein's physical description (6'0", 180 lbs, gray hair, blue eyes) and U.S. passport number (516923892).
The FBI stated the advisory was for notification purposes only and required no specific action from the recipient.
